Detailed Description

This provides a GDI+ compatible color class which (currently) converts to an agg::rgba8 structure. GDI+ stores the color data using 8 bits per component, so it is logical to use a similar method here. It may be possible in the future to provide support for, say, agg::rgba16, but that is not a priority now (and it would probably go against seamless replacement of GDI+.)

VOID AggOO::Color::SetFromCOLORREF ( COLORREF  cr  )  [inline]

Set the color from a COLORREF value

Parameters:
cr Source color as a COLORREF (DWORD)
Remarks:
Since COLORREF is defined on Windows as an unsigned long, and it has been defined in AggOOPixelFormats.h, this should be ok, even on non-Windows platforms.

COLORREF AggOO::Color::ToCOLORREF (  )  const [inline]

Convert the color to a COLORREF value

UINT AggOO::Color::ToPixelFormat ( PixelFormat  PixelFormat  )  const [inline]

Convert the color to a specified format, returning the result as a UINT. The result will be packed in a way that the useful information can be masked out of the least significant bits.

std::string AggOO::Color::GetColorString (  )  const [inline]

Get the color as a string. This can be used by the stream output operator, as well as used as in index for color mapping.
